basics.name: Brad Fincher
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Brad is a full stack software engineer with an eye for front end design and development

highlights: Performed O&M (Operations and Maintenance) on fastest national data/voice 4G LTE wireless network
Engaged in 4G/LTE network deployment with 96% customer coverage achieved in 16 months
Recruited as one of first members of new Network Optimization Team by Director of Operations
Monitored and upgraded nationâ€™s largest data/voice wireless network, including SS7 and backhaul
Repaired and coordinated remote dispatch of field and switch assets in response to network distress conditions
Trained as one of select few technicians versed in all platforms, including: Nortel, Lucent, Ericsson, Alcatel, Fujitsu

projects.name: RNTR
projects.summary: List, find, and rent everyday items from local users | TL;DR -Airbnb for stuff
highlights: Implemented ReactJS components and routing for new listings and location-based search with Webpack
Created custom ReactJS UI using MaterializeCSS and AnimateCSS connected to PostgreSQL and ExpressJS
Utilized ES6 syntax through BabelJS via CommonJS methods for module management
Built out RESTful API HTTP requests for serving listed items, searched items, and listing new items

projects.name: CinemaPlate
projects.summary: Provides Netflix and food delivery pairing recommendations
highlights: Created user profile page with editable email and password fields using HTML, CSS, AngularJS, ExpressJS
Embedded movie trailer selection using HTML, CSS, custom AngularJS directives and TMDB API
Reconfigured legacy code back end API query for video information using BluebirdJS

projects.name: I Like This
projects.summary: Delivers targeted, cross-media recommendations for books, movies, and video games
highlights: Architected and built all front end pages and navigation with HTML, CSS, AngularJS
Integrated AngularJS views to update PostgreSQL database title entries and associated tags
Managed parsing and displaying of data from three different APIs through SQL server
